researchers_stance: V4 is the best version across every metric. The selective restoration strategy — adding back exactly what V3's data proved was load-bearing — delivered 77% conversion, 83% resonance, 8% dealbreakers. This confirms that data-driven editing beats both aggressive cutting (V3) and kitchen-sink inclusion (V2). The qualitative feedback has converged: 'my objections are about the product, not the copy.' We're approaching the copy ceiling.
exec_summary: Hybrid of V3's tighter structure with surgical restoration of three load-bearing elements: the honesty line (journal_graveyard), specific rating examples (taste_curator), and cold-start context (city_explorer). Every metric hit its best-ever value. Qualitative feedback converged to 'the copy is done.'
findings:
• 77% conversion — best ever: +17pp from V3, +10pp from V2. The hybrid strategy outperforms both pure cutting and pure adding.
  • journal_graveyard breakthrough: 50% conversion (from 33% V3). Resonance tripled (25%→75%) confirming the honesty line is load-bearing.
  • fomo_scroller maintained: 83% conversion — nothing that helped them was touched. Protected correctly.
  • city_explorer recovered: 92% conversion (from 58% V3). Two-sentence cold-start is the right balance.
  • Qualitative convergence: Personas saying 'the page is done, now I need to try the product.' All remaining objections are product-level.
recommendations:
1. Run V5 as convergence test: Minimal changes to verify V4 is stable, not a lucky roll.
  2. Micro-polish only: Remove 'random Tuesday night plans' (flagged as forced), clarify 'basic friend activity' in free tier, replace vague 'priority in local discovery.'
  3. Do not add new sections: The page is at its natural length. Any addition risks fomo_scroller regression.
qualitative_themes:
• 'The copy is done' (12 mentions): Across all buckets. Objections are product-level, not copy-level.
  • 'Ship it' (8 mentions): Strongest convergence signal. Personas have stopped evaluating and started wanting to try.
  • Product-level requests dominate (20+ mentions): Screenshots, invite flow, user counts, passive tracking — all beyond copy's scope.
  • Honesty restored, trust returned (5 mentions, journal_graveyard): 'The honesty is back and I trust the page again.'
appendix_notes: V4 represents the hybrid peak: V3 structure + V2 conversion-driving content. V5 will test stability.
